content: The zulip archive seems to be stuck at March 1, anyone know what is going on there?
@Scott Morrison ? The repo looks fine, most likely a server thing.
Gah. That computer is offline, and as I'm in Berkeley for the semester it may be a big pain to get it back online. :-(
Realistically I think we should find a more reliable server for this cron job. Bryan has also just noticed that the online web editor is going stale, for the same reason.
Could we use that Azure thing that now hosts our oleans?

Patrick Massot said:

Could we use that Azure thing that now hosts our oleans?

Took the words right out of my keyboard.
I'm almost certain it can, although there's a small layer of complication in everything to do with Azure.
I'm glad you recovered from your Super Tuesday sickness so that you can go back to Azure fighting.
Half recovered, anyway, we'll see if I make it to work tomorrow...

It seems the Zulip archive bot is having issues. Threads are showing up on the archive page, but recent threads give 404 errors. https://leanprover-community.github.io/archive/113488general/52877Enterlambdainconv.html is the oldest thread I can find giving a 404 (Apr 03 2020 at 10:25). The previous page, https://leanprover-community.github.io/archive/113488general/08031Overlyspecificinstancesininitcategory.html exists (latest: Apr 03 2020 at 05:08)
Oops, this was me fat fingering the update last time I did it by hand. Should be fixed in a second, but not quite up to date.
Needless to say, I haven't found the time yet to pick up the Azure fighting.

is there a way to search the zulip archive? i've found what i was looking for now but i'm wondering whether there's an easy way to search the entire thing for the future.
i suppose using site:https://leanprover-community.github.io/archive/ <query> in google kind of works ...
The Zulip search functionality is quite good (you can restrict to streams, look for posts by a particular person etc)
I mean on the app or website
Yeah, the archive isn't really designed to be used directly. The whole point is for people to land there via search engines.
ah, i just learned that clicking on "search in all public streams" in zulip when scrolling to the top of the search results yields the full search history

i was looking through the archive because i believed that zulip doesn't preserve the full history. turns out that you just need to click that button to look for stuff that happened before your arrival.
